title: [Neuroscience] Gut Microbiota Differences Seen in People With Autism May Be Due to Dietary Preferences. A new study suggests the differences in the gut microbiome associated with autism may be a result of restricted dietary preferences, which are a common feature of ASD, rather than a cause of autism symptoms.

[Health] Coffee & tea drinking may be associated with reduced rates of stroke & dementia. drinking 2 to 3 cups of coffee and 2 to 3 cups of tea per day was associated with a 32% lower risk of stroke & a 28% lower risk of dementia.
